books.title: Winnie-the-Pooh
books.author: A. A. Milne
books.summary: A father tells stories to his son about the son’s stuffed animals come to life.

books.title: Lord Tony’s Wife
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A young woman and her father are kidnapped by a man intent on revenge for his father’s death.

books.title: You Can’t Win
books.author: Jack Black
books.summary: Jack Black’s autobiographical account of life “on the road” as a professional thief and hobo during the late 19th century and early 20th century.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: School Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s school stories about the lives and adventures of schoolboys in the early 1900s.

books.title: The Eumenides
books.author: Aeschylus
books.summary: A man is pursued by wrathful goddesses for avenging his father’s murder, and finds refuge in Athens where a trial determines his fate.

books.title: Thuvia, Maid of Mars
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: When the beautiful Princess Thuvia of Ptarth is kidnapped, suspicion falls on John Carter’s son Carthoris, who sets out to rescue the woman he loves.

books.title: The Woman in White
books.author: Wilkie Collins
books.summary: A young drawing teacher falls in love with his aristocratic pupil, who falls victim to a devious plot to acquire her considerable fortune.

books.title: The Room in the Dragon Volant
books.author: J. Sheridan Le Fanu
books.summary: After an Englishman traveling in France meets a mysterious woman, he becomes embroiled in a dangerous intrigue.

books.title: Incidents in the Life of a Slave Girl
books.author: Linda Brent
books.summary: The autobiography of a woman who grew up in, and escaped from, slavery.

books.title: The Leavenworth Case
books.author: Anna Katharine Green
books.summary: A young New York lawyer becomes embroiled in the investigation of the mysterious murder of a wealthy man.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: The Crowd
books.author: Gustave Le Bon
books.summary: Le Bon explores the psychology, motivations, and dangers of crowds of people.

books.title: New Hampshire
books.author: Robert Frost
books.summary: Robert Frost’s Pulitzer-winning book of poetry.

books.title: The Luck of Barry Lyndon
books.author: William Makepeace Thackeray
books.summary: A poor Irish rogue tries to win fame and fortune in the 18th-century English aristocracy.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.summary: A collection of science fiction stories by Frederik Pohl ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Zuni Folktales
books.author: Frank Hamilton Cushing
books.summary: A collection of folktales from the Zuni culture.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.
